author: Pon Vasanth Arunachalam
text:
Minor protests and human chain formations marked the celebrations of ‘Maatu Pongal’ at Alanganallur and Palamedu in the district on Saturday, the day on which jallikattu should have happened at Palamedu had the Supreme Court not banned it.

Around 750 fans of jallikattu , including women, participated in a human chain at Alanganallur in the morning.

Most of the shops remained closed in Alanganallur and Palamedu.

Black flags were hoisted in many places at Palamedu where a few hundred people had gathered near the jallikattu arena where they sat for a protest briefly raising slogans against the ban.

A minor argument broke out between the police and the protesters as the police upbraided a person for allegedly attempting to let a bull on the streets.

Elaborate security arrangements had been made by the Madurai district police across the district to ensure that nowhere the Supreme Court ban was violated.

The police had earlier taken the list of all the jallikattu bull owners and instructions were given in the villages by the revenue and police officials on the consequence of violating the ban.

14 arrested

Superintendent of Police Vijayendra S. Bidari said 14 people were arrested from different places for allegedly causing disturbance and instigating the public to violate the jallikattu ban.

One person was arrested at Austinpatti for allegedly taking a bull in a mini-truck with the intention of letting it loose on the road. Police sources said that eight more were arrested from Palamedu and five from Vadipatti.
title: Minor protests mark ‘Maatu Pongal’ celebrations
